The Delta II is only designated with the "Heavy" classification when it flies with 9 GEM-46 solid rocket motors. It's just called a Delta II 792x when it flies with the more commonly used GEM-40 solid rocket motors. Also, the are 2 different variants of the GEM-40 SRMs (Ground-lit & Air-lit) and 3 different variants of the GEM-46 SRMs (Thrust Vector Controlled Ground-Lit, Ground-Lit & Air-Lit).

When Delta II flies with 9 SRMs, only 6 are ignited at liftoff (hence the "Ground-Lit" part in their name), and 3 of the SRMs are ignited 1.7 seconds before the ground-lit SRMs burn out and are jettisoned. That is why there are always 3 motors burning for longer than the other 6.
